summary: This bill, the Homeless Children and Youth Act of 2025, amends the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act to better address the needs of homeless children, youth, and families. It expands definitions of homelessness, clarifies eligibility for programs, and mandates the public availability of Homeless Management Information System (HMIS) data. The bill also modifies grant awarding processes, reporting requirements, and emphasizes collaboration with local agencies. Key changes include updated definitions, prioritization of community-based assessments, and a focus on cost-effectiveness in program implementation.
